intro: Erigeron conditii, commonly known as the Sierra daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron conditii is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
